column1: Art Institute of Chicago////There is so much to see here
column2: you almost need two days to see it all! They have really built up some excellent exhibit space
column3: particularly in the medieval and renaissance halls.  The cafe is outrageously expensive
column4: a wrap costing $12.  We came with our grandmother who was getting around with a cane.  We quickly realized that certain parts of the building were not designed well for accessibility.  For example
column5: some bathrooms off the modern hall entrance required to move two sets of heavier doors.  Grandma actually hurt herself and came out into the hall bleeding after one of the doors was almost impassible for her.
